title: Eliminate a Variable
text: The y's are already opposites so they will be eliminated once we add up the two equations.\n$$x+y=-1$$\n$$x-y=-5$$

title: Add the Equations to Eliminate One Variable
text: Add the x's, y's, and constants. $$y$$ will be eliminated and then solve for $$x$$.\n$$2x=-6$$\n$$x=-3$$

title: Substitute Solution into Original Equations
text:
Substitute $$x=-3$$ into the first equation, $$x+y=-1$$. Then solve for $$y$$.
$$x+y=-1$$
$$\left(-3ight)+y=-1$$
$$y=2$$

title: Solution as Ordered Pair
text: Solution to the system of equations is $$(-3,2)$$.
